head.title: National Briefing | Midwest: Illinois: Your Picture Is Ready. What Do We Do With It?

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Midwest: Illinois: Your Picture Is Ready. What Do We Do With It?

abstract.p: Portrait of former Gov George George Ryan of Illinois waits to be hung in Hall of Governors at Executive Mansion in Springfield until Ryan informs officials how he wishes it to be unveiled; several of Ryan's top aides have been indicted (S)

block.p: A recently finished portrait of former Gov. George Ryan, which is supposed to be added to the Hall of Governors in the Executive Mansion in Springfield, waits in limbo instead, because state officials are unsure how Mr. Ryan wants to unveil his likeness. Many governors opt for a formal ceremony in the Senate Chamber Room and sometimes a luncheon. But a federal investigation has resulted in several indictments against Mr. Ryan's top aides, and he has yet to give the state a directive.

A recently finished portrait of former Gov. George Ryan, which is supposed to be added to the Hall of Governors in the Executive Mansion in Springfield, waits in limbo instead, because state officials are unsure how Mr. Ryan wants to unveil his likeness. Many governors opt for a formal ceremony in the Senate Chamber Room and sometimes a luncheon. But a federal investigation has resulted in several indictments against Mr. Ryan's top aides, and he has yet to give the state a directive.

Correction: September 25, 2003, Thursday Because of an editing error, a report in the National Briefing column on Tuesday about the addition of a portrait of former Gov. George Ryan to the Illinois Hall of Governors misidentified the location. The hall is in the Capitol, not the executive mansion.
